continental.description: A network of farms and ranches surrounds the cities and small towns near the Nebraska–Iowa border.

maritime.description: Phytoplankton blooms across the northern basins of the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans.

coastal.description: The pristine sand dunes near the launch pads at KSC are gently washed by the calm blue Atlantic Ocean.

mountains.description: The Cuernos del Paine mountains in Torres del Paine National Park, Chile, during NASA's AirSAR 2004 campaign.

island.description: The Republic of Maldives with its twenty-six atolls, and 1192 coral islands, with an average ground elevation of 1.5 meters (about 5 feet).

desert.description: The lidar on its tripod. NASA/GSFC

forest.description: Tropical forests, such as those in Gabon, Africa, are an important reservoir of carbon. (Photography courtesy Sassan Saatchi, NASA/JPL-Caltech.)

urban.description: The narrow island of Manhattan, located between the Hudson River and the East River.

agricultural.description: Variegated green crop circles cover what was once shortgrass prairie in southwestern Kansas.

polar.description: A NASA scientific balloon awaits launch in McMurdo, Antarctica.

sea ice.description: Sea ice hugging the coast of East Greenland.

coral.description: Great Barrier Reef near Whitsunday Islands.

rainforest.description: A stream in the La Selva region of the Costa Rican rain forest, taken during NASA's AirSAR 2004 campaign.

96b56413-2068-4fc4-a093-4780a02744e9.description: A scientist of the National Center for Atmospheric Research checks out the NOxyO3 instrument on NASA's DC-8 flying laboratory before the ARCTAS mission

c63849f7-ea91-4525-9029-940a9c53ed36.description: A remotely-piloted aircraft that study thunderstorms flies through the sky

28154c07-d35b-4e13-982c-63b69e1fe57c.description: Tuolumne River Basin seen by NASA Airborne Snow Observatory

a0dea5de-aa33-4f13-a8a4-34729e3de5fd.description: NASA’s B200 taking off for an eight-hour science flight

87650e20-ecf3-4703-aeed-49c8affc6059.description: A weather balloon takes flight equipped with a radiosonde.

6fc94f62-d4f2-4a08-9511-2234d91b0665.description: NASA's DC-8 flying laboratory seen at sunset after a flight supporting the AirSAR 2004 Mesoamerica campaign

bb761da6-1606-444c-92d1-e6d30954f2d7.description: The NASA ER-2 airplane flies over hurricane Dennis as part of the Tropical Cloud Systems and Processes TSCP Mission

5a5ffdbe-0eae-48b1-a7ad-d63dfebffb9a.description: Gulfstream III aircraft equipped with NASA's UAVSAR instrument on a tarmack

ad8a0ce5-8aae-4fe5-8b46-7586c267efdb.description: NASA's Global Hawk 872 lifting off the runway at Edwards Air Force Base

2cbc931a-6f47-45f0-bff6-659ef2efc68d.description: A view of the launch of Space Shuttle Atlantis, taken from NASA's WB-57 aircraft
